title: USGS Landsat 8 Collection 2 Tier 1 Raw Scenes
description:
Landsat 8 Collection 2 Tier 1 DN values, representing scaled, calibrated at-sensor radiance.

Landsat scenes with the highest available data quality
are placed into Tier 1 and are considered suitable for time-series processing
analysis. Tier 1 includes Level-1 Precision Terrain (L1TP) processed data
that have well-characterized radiometry and are inter-calibrated across the
different Landsat sensors. The georegistration of Tier 1 scenes will be
consistent and within prescribed tolerances [<=12 m root mean square error
(RMSE)]. All Tier 1 Landsat data can be considered consistent and
inter-calibrated (regardless of sensor) across the full collection. See more
information [in the USGS
docs](https://www.usgs.gov/core-science-systems/nli/landsat/landsat-collections).

links.title: Run the example for LANDSAT/LC08/C02/T1 in the Earth Engine Code Editor

values.description: Cloud is not dilated or no cloud
Cloud Shadow Confidence is not high
Cloud or Dilated Cloud bits are set
Cloud and Dilated Cloud bits are not set

gee:schema.description: Percentage cloud cover (0-100), -1 = not calculated.
gee:schema.name: CLOUD_COVER

gee:schema.description: Percentage cloud cover over land (0-100), -1 = not calculated.
gee:schema.name: CLOUD_COVER_LAND

gee:schema.description: Tier of scene. (T1 or T2)
gee:schema.name: COLLECTION_CATEGORY

gee:schema.description: Number of collection.
gee:schema.name: COLLECTION_NUMBER

gee:schema.description:
Indicates the source of the DEM used in the
correction process. Possible values: "GLS2000", "RAMP", "GTOPO30".'
gee:schema.name: DATA_SOURCE_ELEVATION

gee:schema.description:
The correction source used in creating the Landsat 8 TIRS stray light
correction image. This field is not included for Landsat 9.
gee:schema.name: DATA_SOURCE_TIRS_STRAY_LIGHT_CORRECTION

gee:schema.description: Image acquisition date. "YYYY-MM-DD"
gee:schema.name: DATE_ACQUIRED

gee:schema.description: Product generation epoch.
gee:schema.name: DATE_PRODUCT_GENERATED

gee:schema.description: Datum used in image creation.
gee:schema.name: DATUM

gee:schema.description: Earth sun distance in astronomical units (AU).
gee:schema.name: EARTH_SUN_DISTANCE

gee:schema.description: Ellipsoid used in image creation.
gee:schema.name: ELLIPSOID

gee:schema.description:
Combined Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) of the geometric residuals
(meters) in both across-track and along-track directions
measured on the GCPs used in geometric precision correction.
Not present in L1G products.
gee:schema.name: GEOMETRIC_RMSE_MODEL

gee:schema.description:
RMSE of the X direction geometric residuals (in meters) measured
on the GCPs used in geometric precision correction. Not present in
L1G products.
gee:schema.name: GEOMETRIC_RMSE_MODEL_X

gee:schema.description:
RMSE of the Y direction geometric residuals (in meters) measured
on the GCPs used in geometric precision correction. Not present in
L1G products.
gee:schema.name: GEOMETRIC_RMSE_MODEL_Y

gee:schema.description: Grid cell size used in creating the image for the panchromatic band.
gee:schema.name: GRID_CELL_SIZE_PANCHROMATIC

gee:schema.description: Grid cell size used in creating the image for the reflective band.
gee:schema.name: GRID_CELL_SIZE_REFLECTIVE

gee:schema.description: Grid cell size used in creating the image for the thermal band.
gee:schema.name: GRID_CELL_SIZE_THERMAL

gee:schema.description:
The number of ground control points used. Not used in L1GT products.
Values: 0 - 999 (0 is used for L1T products that have used
Multi-scene refinement).
gee:schema.name: GROUND_CONTROL_POINTS_MODEL

gee:schema.description:
The number of ground control points used in the verification of
the terrain corrected product. Values: -1 to 1615 (-1 = not available)
gee:schema.name: GROUND_CONTROL_POINTS_VERSION

gee:schema.description: The composite image quality for the OLI bands. Values: 9 = Best. 1 = Worst. 0 = Image quality not calculated. This parameter is only present if OLI bands are present in the product.
gee:schema.name: IMAGE_QUALITY_OLI

gee:schema.description: The composite image quality for the TIRS bands. Values: 9 = Best. 1 = Worst. 0 = Image quality not calculated. This parameter is only present if OLI bands are present in the product.
gee:schema.name: IMAGE_QUALITY_TIRS

gee:schema.description: Calibration K1 constant for Band 10 radiance to temperature conversion.
gee:schema.name: K1_CONSTANT_BAND_10

gee:schema.description: Calibration K1 constant for Band 11 radiance to temperature conversion.
gee:schema.name: K1_CONSTANT_BAND_11

gee:schema.description: Calibration K2 constant for Band 10 radiance to temperature conversion.
gee:schema.name: K2_CONSTANT_BAND_10

gee:schema.description: Calibration K2 constant for Band 11 radiance to temperature conversion.
gee:schema.name: K2_CONSTANT_BAND_11

gee:schema.description:
The naming convention of each Landsat Collection N Level-1 image based
on acquisition parameters and processing parameters.

Format: LXSS_LLLL_PPPRRR_YYYYMMDD_yyyymmdd_CC_TX

*  L = Landsat
*  X = Sensor (O = Operational Land Imager,
T = Thermal Infrared Sensor, C = Combined OLI/TIRS)
*  SS = Satellite (08 = Landsat 8)
*  LLLL = Processing Correction Level (L1TP = precision and terrain,
L1GT = systematic terrain, L1GS = systematic)
*  PPP = WRS Path
*  RRR = WRS Row
*  YYYYMMDD = Acquisition Date expressed in Year, Month, Day
*  yyyymmdd = Processing Date expressed in Year, Month, Day
*  CC = Collection Number (02)
*  TX = Collection Category (RT = Real Time, T1 = Tier 1, T2 = Tier 2)
gee:schema.name: LANDSAT_PRODUCT_ID

gee:schema.description:
The Pre-Collection naming convention of each image is based on acquisition
parameters. This was the naming convention used prior to Collection 1.

Format: LXSPPPRRRYYYYDDDGSIVV

*  L = Landsat
*  X = Sensor (O = Operational Land Imager, T = Thermal Infrared Sensor, C = Combined OLI/TIRS)
*  S = Satellite (08 = Landsat 8)
*  PPP = WRS Path
*  RRR = WRS Row
*  YYYY = Year of Acquisition
*  DDD = Julian Day of Acquisition
*  GSI = Ground Station Identifier
*  VV = Version
gee:schema.name: LANDSAT_SCENE_ID

gee:schema.description: Projection used to represent the 3-dimensional surface of the earth for the Level-1 product.
gee:schema.name: MAP_PROJECTION

gee:schema.description: Nadir or Off-Nadir condition of the scene.
gee:schema.name: NADIR_OFFNADIR

gee:schema.description: Orientation used in creating the image. Values: NOMINAL = Nominal Path, NORTH_UP = North Up, TRUE_NORTH = True North, USER = User
gee:schema.name: ORIENTATION

gee:schema.description: Number of product lines for the panchromatic band.
gee:schema.name: PANCHROMATIC_LINES

gee:schema.description: Number of product samples for the panchromatic bands.
gee:schema.name: PANCHROMATIC_SAMPLES

gee:schema.description: Name and version of the processing software used to generate the L1 product.
gee:schema.name: PROCESSING_SOFTWARE_VERSION

gee:schema.description:
Request id, nnnyymmdd0000_0000

*  nnn = node number
*  yy = year
*  mm = month
*  dd = day
gee:schema.name: REQUEST_ID

gee:schema.description: Resampling option used in creating the image.
gee:schema.name: RESAMPLING_OPTION

gee:schema.description: The amount of spacecraft roll angle at the scene center.
gee:schema.name: ROLL_ANGLE

gee:schema.description: Flag indicating saturated pixels for band 1 ('Y'/'N')
gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_1

gee:schema.description: Flag indicating saturated pixels for band 10 ('Y'/'N')
gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_10

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_11

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_2

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_3

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_4

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_5

gee:schema.description: Flag indicating saturated pixels for band 6 ('Y'/'N')
gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_6

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_7

gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_8

gee:schema.description: Flag indicating saturated pixels for band 9 ('Y'/'N')
gee:schema.name: SATURATION_BAND_9

gee:schema.description:
Scene center time of acquired image. HH:MM:SS.SSSSSSSZ

*  HH = Hour (00-23)
*  MM = Minutes
*  SS.SSSSSSS = Fractional seconds
*  Z = "Zulu" time (same as GMT)
gee:schema.name: SCENE_CENTER_TIME

gee:schema.description: Sensor used to capture data.
gee:schema.name: SENSOR_ID

gee:schema.description: Spacecraft identification.
gee:schema.name: SPACECRAFT_ID

gee:schema.description: Ground Station/Organisation that received the data.
gee:schema.name: STATION_ID

gee:schema.description: Sun azimuth angle in degrees for the image center location at the image center acquisition time.
gee:schema.name: SUN_AZIMUTH

gee:schema.description: Sun elevation angle in degrees for the image center location at the image center acquisition time.
gee:schema.name: SUN_ELEVATION

gee:schema.description: Nearest WRS-2 path to the line-of-sight scene center of the image.
gee:schema.name: TARGET_WRS_PATH

gee:schema.description: Nearest WRS-2 row to the line-of-sight scene center of the image. Rows 880-889 and 990-999 are reserved for the polar regions where it is undefined in the WRS-2.
gee:schema.name: TARGET_WRS_ROW

gee:schema.description: Number of product lines for the thermal band.
gee:schema.name: THERMAL_LINES

gee:schema.description: Number of product samples for the thermal band.
gee:schema.name: THERMAL_SAMPLES

gee:schema.description:
Due to an anomalous condition on the Thermal Infrared
Sensor (TIRS) Scene Select Mirror (SSM) encoder electronics,
this field has been added to indicate which model was used to process the data.
(Actual, Preliminary, Final)
gee:schema.name: TIRS_SSM_MODEL

gee:schema.description: TIRS SSM position status.
gee:schema.name: TIRS_SSM_POSITION_STATUS

gee:schema.description: TIRS stray light correction source.
gee:schema.name: TIRS_STRAY_LIGHT_CORRECTION_SOURCE

gee:schema.description: Region of OLCI truncated.
gee:schema.name: TRUNCATION_OLI

gee:schema.description: UTM zone number used in product map projection.
gee:schema.name: UTM_ZONE

gee:schema.description: The WRS orbital path number (001 - 251).
gee:schema.name: WRS_PATH

gee:schema.description: Landsat satellite WRS row (001-248).
gee:schema.name: WRS_ROW

gee:schema.description: World Reference System (WRS) type used for the collection of this scene.
gee:schema.name: WRS_TYPE

gee:terms_of_use:
Landsat datasets are federally created data
and therefore reside in the public domain and may be used, transferred, or reproduced without copyright restriction.

Acknowledgement or credit of the USGS as data source should be provided
by including a line of text citation such as the example shown below.

(Product, Image, Photograph, or Dataset Name) courtesy of
the U.S. Geological Survey

Example: Landsat-7 image courtesy of the U.S. Geological Survey

See the
[USGS Visual Identity System Guidance](https://www.usgs.gov/information-policies-and-instructions/usgs-visual-identity-system)
for further details on proper citation and acknowledgement of USGS products.
